member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Animation.Point.Formula
member.summary:
Formulas within values, from, to, by attributes can be made up of these: Standard arithmetic operators: +, -, *, /, ^, % (mod) Constants: pi e Conditional operators: abs, min, max, ? (if) Comparison operators: '==', '>=', '', '!=', '!' Trigonometric operators: sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan() Natural logarithm ln() Property references (host supported properties)
for example: "#ppt_x+(cos(-2*pi*(1-$))*-#ppt_x-sin(-2*pi*(1-$))*(1-#ppt_y))*(1-$)" Read/write .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.BlobManagementOptions
member.summary: Represents options which can be used to manage BLOB handling rules and other BLOB settings.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BlobManagementOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new default blob management options.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BlobManagementOptions.PresentationLockingBehavior
member.summary: Represents the locking behavior for the presentation's source (stream or file).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BlobManagementOptions.IsTemporaryFilesAllowed
member.summary: Set that using of temporary files is not allowed to optimize memory consumption while working with large amounts of data during presentation's lifetime. If false, OutOfMemoryException can be thrown.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BlobManagementOptions.TempFilesRootPath
member.summary: Represents the root path on the filesystem, where the temporary files will be stored. System temorary directory will be used by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BlobManagementOptions.MaxBlobsBytesInMemory
member.summary: A threshold that indicates the maximum amount of bytes which BLOBs can occupied in memory. After this threshold was reached, all new BLOBs will be placed in temporary files and will not affect the total memory consumption of the process. should be set to true to use this property.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat
member.summary: Represents formatting options for DataLabel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource
member.summary: Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.NumberFormat
member.summary: Represents the format string for the DataLabels object. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the NumberFormat property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Represents the format string for the DataLabel objects. Set this property with value also sets this value to the NumberFormat property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.NumberFormat = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].NumberFormat is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.Format
member.summary: Represents the format of the data label. Read-only .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property represents the default format for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.Position
member.summary: Represents the position of the data label. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the Position property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Represents the position for the DataLabel objects. Set this property with value also sets this value to the Position property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.Position = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].Position is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.ShowLegendKey
member.summary: Represents a specified chart's data label legend key display behavior. True if the data label legend key is visible. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the ShowLegendKey property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the ShowLegendKey property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.ShowLegendKey = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].ShowLegendKey is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.ShowValue
member.summary: Represents a specified chart's data label percentage value display behavior. True displays the percentage value. False to hide. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the ShowValue property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the ShowValue property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.ShowValue = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].ShowValue is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.ShowCategoryName
member.summary: Represents a specified chart's data label category name display behavior. True to display the category name for the data labels on a chart. False to hide. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.ShowLabelValueFromCell
member.summary: Represents a specified chart's data label cell value display behavior. True displays cell value. False to hide. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the ShowLabelValueFromCell property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the ShowLabelValueFromCell property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.ShowLabelValueFromCell = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].ShowLabelValueFromCell is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.ShowLabelAsDataCallout
member.summary:
Determines either specified chart's data label will be displayed as data callout or as data label.
If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the ShowLabelAsDataCallout property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the ShowLabelAsDataCallout property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.ShowLabelAsDataCallout = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].ShowLabelAsDataCallout is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.Separator
member.summary: Sets or returns a Variant representing the separator used for the data labels on a chart. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the Separator property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the Separator property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.Separator = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].Separator is equal to val).

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartPortionFormat
member.summary: This class contains the chart portion formatting properties used in charts. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate text portion formatting properties defined for the particular portion. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.summary: Represents data used for a chart plotting.

member.summary: Gets the cells factory to create cells used for chart series or categories. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.Series
member.summary: Gets the series. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.SeriesGroups
member.summary: Gets the groups of series. Read-only .
member.remarks:
1) Each group of series contains series with combinable types. Groups of combinable series types defined and described with CombinableSeriesTypesGroup enum. Also each group of series contains series witch is plotted whether on primary axes or on secondary axes (not both cases in one group). So, principle of series grouping is a grouping by type groups mentioned above and by primary/secondary plotting type.
2) Group of series contains some series properies whitch is common for each series in group ("series group properties"). "Series group properties" in ChartSeriesGroup class is read/write. Each of "series group properties" can have a read-only projection in ChartSeries class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartDataPointCollection.GetOrCreateDataPointByIdx(System.UInt32)
member.summary: If collection already contains data point with index then returns this data point. If collection doesn't contains data point with index ==N (when number of data points in this collection is less or equal then N) then adds deficient data points and returns last (which has requested index). For example, collection indexes are {0, 1, 2}, and requested index is 5. Then method adds deficient data points: {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5}. And returns data point with index 5.
member.returns: Returns data point with requested index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.TrendLines
member.summary: Collection of series trend lines. Read-only .
member.remarks: TrendLines are available (not null) for data series in unstacked 2-D area, bar, column, line, stock, xy (scatter), and bubble charts. A trendline are not available for data series in any chart type that is stacked or 3-D. Trendlines are also not available for radar, pie, surface, or doughnut charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.ErrorBarsXFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection X.
ErrorBars with X direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).
Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.ErrorBarsYFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection Y.
ErrorBars with Y direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, line, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).
Read-only .

member.summary: Returns an automatic color of series based on series index and chart style. This color is used by default if FillType equals NotDefined.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.HasUpDownBars
member.summary: Determines whether Line- or Stock-chart has a up/down bars. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars.HasUpDownBars read/write property for change value. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars property for format up/down bars. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars.HasUpDownBars.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.GapWidth
member.summary: Specifies the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.GapWidth read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.GapWidth.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.GapDepth
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance, as a percentage of the marker width, between the data series in a 3D chart. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.GapDepth read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.GapDepth.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.FirstSliceAngle
member.summary: Specifies the angle of the first pie or doughnut chart slice, in degrees (clockwise from up, from 0 to 360 degrees). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.FirstSliceAngle read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.FirstSliceAngle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.DoughnutHoleSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the hole in a doughnut chart (can be between 10 and 90 percents of the size of the plot area.). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.DoughnutHoleSize read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.DoughnutHoleSize.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.Overlap
member.summary: Specifies how much bars and columns shall overlap on 2-D charts (from -100 to 100). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.Overlap read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.Overlap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.SecondPieSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the second pie or bar of a pie-of-pie chart or a bar-of-pie chart, as a percentage of the size of the first pie (can be between 5 and 200 percents). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.SecondPieSize read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.SecondPieSize.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.HasSeriesLines
member.summary: Determines whether there are series lines for this series and kindred series. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.HasSeriesLines read/write property for change value. Use ParentSeriesGroup.SeriesLinesFormat property for format series lines. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.HasSeriesLines.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.PieSplitPosition
member.summary: Specifies a value that shall be used to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart. Is used together with PieSplitBy property. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitPosition read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitPosition.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.PieSplitBy
member.summary: Specifies how to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitBy read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: 1) This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitBy. 2) If property value is PieSplitBy.Custom then you can define custom split information with ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitCustomPoints property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.PieSplitCustomPoints
member.summary: The custom split information for a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart with a custom split. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitCustomPoints.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D
member.summary: Represents 3D rotation of a chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.RotationX
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation degree around the X-axis, i.e. in the Y direction for 3D charts (between -90 and 90 degrees). The property matches with the 21.2.2.157 rotX (X Rotation) item in ECMA-376 and with the "Y Rotation" option in PowerPoint 2007+. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.RotationY
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation degree around the Y-axis, i.e. in the X direction for 3D charts (between 0 and 360 degrees). The property matches with the 21.2.2.158 rotY (Y Rotation) item in ECMA-376 and with the "X Rotation" option in PowerPoint 2007+. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.Perspective
member.summary: Returns or sets the perspective value (field of view angle) for 3D charts (between 0 and 240). Ignored if RightAngleAxes property value is true. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.RightAngleAxes
member.summary: Determines whether the chart axes are at right angles, rather than drawn in perspective. In other words it determines whether the chart angles of axes are independent from chart rotation or elevation. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.DepthPercents
member.summary: Returns or sets the depth of a 3D chart as a percentage of a chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.HeightPercents
member.summary: Specifies the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent). Read/write .

member.summary: Gets or sets name of the trendline. Read/write .

member.summary: Gets or sets type of trend line. Read/write .

member.summary: Represents the format of the trend line. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Backward
member.summary: Specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trend line extends before the data for the series that is being trended. On scatter and non-scatter charts, the value shall be any nonnegative value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Forward
member.summary: Specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends after the data for the series that is being trended. On scatter and non-scatter charts, the value shall be any non-negative value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Intercept
member.summary: Specifies the value where the trendline shall cross the y axis. This property shall be supported only when the trendline type is exp, linear, or poly. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.DisplayEquation
member.summary: Specifies that the equation for the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the Rsquaredvalue). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Order
member.summary: Specifies the order of the polynomial trend line. It is ignored for other trend line types. Value must be between 2 and 6. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Period
member.summary: Specifies the period of the trend line for a moving average trend line. It is ignored for other trend line variants. Value must be between 2 and 255. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.DisplayRSquaredValue
member.summary: Specifies that the R-squared value of the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the equation). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.RelatedLegendEntry
member.summary: Represents legend entry related with this trendline Read-only .

member.summary: Initialize TextFrameForOverriding with the text in paramener "text". If TextFrameForOverriding is already initialized then simply changes its text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.TextFrameForOverriding
member.summary: Can contain a rich formatted text. If this property is not null then this formatted text value overrides auto-generated text of data label. Auto-generated text of data label means text that is managed by ShowSeriesName, ShowValue, ... properties and is formatted with the TextFormatManager.TextFormat property. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns text format. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains classes for work with various effects in Microsoft PowerPoint presentations.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaBiLevel
member.summary: Represents an Alpha Bi-Level effect. Alpha (Opacity) values less than the threshold are changed to 0 (fully transparent) and alpha values greater than or equal to the threshold are changed to 100% (fully opaque).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaBiLevel.Threshold
member.summary: Returns effect threshold. Read/write .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaBiLevelEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Bi-Level effect. Alpha (Opacity) values less than the threshold are changed to 0 (fully transparent) and alpha values greater than or equal to the threshold are changed to 100% (fully opaque).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaBiLevelEffectiveData.Threshold
member.summary: Returns a threshold. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaCeiling
member.summary: Represents an Alpha Ceiling effect. Alpha (opacity) values greater than zero are changed to 100%. In other words, anything partially opaque becomes fully opaque.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaCeilingEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Ceiling effect. Alpha (opacity) values greater than zero are changed to 100%. In other words, anything partially opaque becomes fully opaque.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaFloor
member.summary: Represents an Alpha Floor effect. Alpha (opacity) values less than 100% are changed to zero. In other words, anything partially transparent becomes fully transparent.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaFloorEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Floor effect. Alpha (opacity) values less than 100% are changed to zero. In other words, anything partially transparent becomes fully transparent.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaInverse
member.summary: Represents an Alpha Inverse effect. Alpha (opacity) values are inverted by subtracting from 100%.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaInverseEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Inverse effect. Alpha (opacity) values are inverted by subtracting from 100%.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaModulate
member.summary: Represents an Alpha Modulate effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage. The effect container specifies an effect containing alpha values to modulate.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaModulateEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Modulate effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage. The effect container specifies an effect containing alpha values to modulate.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaModulateFixed
member.summary: Represents an Alpha Modulate Fixed effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaModulateFixed.Amount
member.summary: Returns an amount of effect in percents. Read/write .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaModulateFixedEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Modulate Fixed effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaModulateFixedEffectiveData.Amount
member.summary: Returns the effect amount. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaReplace
member.summary: Represents and Alpha Replace effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are replaced by a fixed alpha.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaReplaceEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents and Alpha Replace effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are replaced by a fixed alpha.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.AlphaReplaceEffectiveData.Alpha
member.summary: Returns new alpha value in the interval [0..1] Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.BiLevel
member.summary: Represents a Bi-Level (black/white) effect. Input colors whose luminance is less than the specified threshold value are changed to black. Input colors whose luminance are greater than or equal the specified value are set to white. The alpha effect values are unaffected by this effect.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.BiLevelEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents a Bi-Level (black/white) effect. Input colors whose luminance is less than the specified threshold value are changed to black. Input colors whose luminance are greater than or equal the specified value are set to white. The alpha effect values are unaffected by this effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.BiLevelEffectiveData.Threshold
member.summary: Returns the threshold value. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.Blur
member.summary: Represents a Blur effect that is applied to the entire shape, including its fill. All color channels, including alpha, are affected.

member.summary: Returns or sets the left margin (points) in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the right margin (points) in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the top margin (points) in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the bottom margin (points) in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.WrapText
member.summary: True if text is wrapped at TextFrame's margins. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.AnchoringType
member.summary: Returns or sets vertical anchor text in a TextFrameEx. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.CenterText
member.summary: If NullableBool.True then text should be centered in box horizontally. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.TextVerticalType
member.summary: Determines text orientation. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and custom angle in property RotationAngle. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.AutofitType
member.summary: Returns or sets text's autofit mode. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.ColumnCount
member.summary: Returns or sets number of columns in the text area. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Value 0 means undefined value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between text columns in the text area (in points). This should only apply when there is more than 1 column present. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.RotationAngle
member.summary: Specifies custom the rotation that is being applied to the text within the bounding box. If it not specified, the rotation of the accompanying shape is used. If it is specified, then this is applied independently from the shape. That is the shape can have a rotation applied in addition to the text itself having a rotation applied to it. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and predefined vertical type in property TextVerticalType. Read/write .
member.example: Consider the case where a shape has a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise applied to it. In addition to this, the text body itself has a rotation of -90 degrees counter-clockwise applied to it. Then the resulting shape would appear to be rotated but the text within it would appear as though it had not been rotated at all.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.HtmlOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Returns or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside PDF document. Read/write .

remarks.p: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in PDF format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.
The default value is 95.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.EmbedTrueTypeFontsForASCII
member.summary: Determines if Aspose.Slides will embed common fonts for ASCII (33..127 code range) text. Fonts for character codes greater than 127 are always embedded. Common fonts list includes PDF's base 14 fonts and additional user specified fonts. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.summary: Returns or sets an array of user-defined names of font families which Aspose.Slides should consider common. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines if all characters of font should be embedded or only used subset. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Returns or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside PDF document. Read/write .

remarks.p: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in PDF format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.
The default value is 100.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.Compliance
member.summary: Desired conformance level for generated PDF document. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.Password
member.summary: Setting user password to protect the PDF document. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.SaveMetafilesAsPng
member.summary: True to convert all metafiles used in a presentation to the PNG images. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is true. Pdf document can contain vector graphics and raster images. If SaveMetafilesAsPng is set to true then source Metafile image is converted to Png format and saved to Pdf as a raster image. If SaveMetafilesAsPng is set to false then source Metafile is converted to Pdf vector graphics. Each approach has advantages and disadvantages.For example, if Metafile is converted to PNG, then some quality loss is possible during resulting document scaling.If Metafile is converted to Pdf vector graphics, then performance issues in Pdf viewing tool are possible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.SufficientResolution
member.summary:
Returns or sets a value determining resolution of images inside PDF document.
Property affects on file size, time of export and image quality.
The default value is 96.Effect of this parameter depends on few factors. Algorithm tries to get best output image size according to the property value, source image size and image frame size. Using of similar property values may give the same result. Recommended to use step 16 or 32 to get visible effect. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.DrawSlidesFrame
member.summary: True to draw black frame around each slide. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.IncludeComments
member.summary: True to insert comment pages into generated PDF. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.summary: Set or returns sound mode for slide transition. Read/write .

member.summary: This attribute specifies if the sound will loop until the next sound event occurs in slideshow. Read/write .

member.summary: Specifies whether a mouse click will advance the slide or not. If this attribute is not specified then a value of true is assumed. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.AdvanceAfterTime
member.summary: Specifies the time, in milliseconds, after which the transition should start. This setting may be used in conjunction with the advClick attribute. If this attribute is not specified then it is assumed that no auto-advance will occur. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.Speed
member.summary: Specifies the transition speed that is to be used when transitioning from the current slide to the next. Read/write .

member.summary: Slide show transition value. Read-only .

member.summary: Type of transition. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.SoundIsBuiltIn
member.summary: Specifies whether or not this sound is a built-in sound. If this attribute is set to true then the generating application is alerted to check the name attribute specified for this sound in it's list of built-in sounds and can then surface a custom name or UI as needed. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SlideShow.SlideShowTransition.SoundName
member.summary: Specifies a human readable name for the sound of the transition. The property must be assigned to get or set the sound name. Read-write .
member.remarks: This name appears in the PowerPoint user interface when configuring the transition sound manually.
member.exception: When property is not assigned.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified layout slide to specified position of the collection.
member.remarks: New layout will be linked with parent master slide for this layout slides collection. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.Add(Aspose.Slides.SlideLayoutType,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new layout slide to the end of the collection.
member.param: Layout type for a new layout. Supported layout types: Title, TitleOnly, Blank, TitleAndObject, VerticalText, VerticalTitleAndText, TwoObjects, SectionHeader, TwoTextAndTwoObjects, TitleObjectAndCaption, PictureAndCaption, Custom. Other layout types are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

Name for a new layout. If passed name is already in use the ArgumentException will be thrown. If null parameter is passed then name genarated atomatically in regards to passed layout type (for example "Title Slide" or "1_Title Slide", "2_..", etc.).
member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.
Thrown if layout name value is already in use in this collection of the layouts.
member.remarks: 1) Added layout for value SlideLayoutType.Custom of contains no placeholders and no shapes. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index of the collection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to remove.
member.exception: Thrown if layout is used in presentation (its HasDependingSlides property is true).
member.remarks: 1) To avoid throwing of the PptxEditException check layout's HasDependingSlides property before. 2) You can use also method to simplify code.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.Reorder(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Moves layout slide from the collection to the specified position.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.GlobalLayoutSlideCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of all layout slides in presentation. Extends LayoutSlideCollection class with methods for adding/cloning layout slides in context of uniting of the individual collections of master's layout slides.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.GlobalLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the presentation.
member.remarks: When cloning a layout between different presentations layout's master can be cloned too to keep source formatting. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.GlobalLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the presentation.
member.param: Master slide for a new layout.
member.remarks: 1) New layout will be linked with defined master in destination presentation. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify additional options (such as format or default font) when loading a presentation.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new default load options.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.#ctor(Aspose.Slides.LoadFormat)
member.summary: Creates new load options.
member.param: Format of a presentation to load.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.LoadFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets format of a presentation to load. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.DefaultRegularFont
member.summary: Returns or sets Regular font used in case source font is not found. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.DefaultSymbolFont
member.summary: Returns or sets Symbol font used in case source font is not found. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.DefaultAsianFont
member.summary: Returns or sets Asian font used in case source font is not found. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.OnlyLoadDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected. Value of true means that only document properties must be loaded from an encrypted presentation file and password must be ignored. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation must be loaded with use of right password. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always ignored. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public and property value is true then document properties cannot be loaded and exception will be thrown. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.WarningCallback
member.summary: Returns or sets an object which receives warnings and decides whether loading process will continue or will be aborted. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.BlobManagementOptions
member.summary: Represents the options which can be used to manage Binary Large Objects (BLOBs) handling behavior, such as using of temporary files or max BLOBs bytes in memory. These options intended to set up the best performance/memory consumption ratio for a perticular environment or requirements. A Binary Large Object (BLOB) is a binary data stored as a single entity - i.e. BLOB can be an audio, video or presentation itself.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.DocumentLevelFontSources
member.summary: Specifies sources for external fonts to be used by the presentation. These fonts are available to the presentation throughout its lifetime and are not shared with other presentations

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Import.HtmlExternalResolver
member.summary: Callback object used by HTML import routine to obtain referrenced objects such as images. Using this resolver could create a vulnurability when client provided HTML file will make server software to obtain local or network file. Use with caution. It is recommended not to specify HtmlExternalResolver at all (only embedded objects will be read) or create some subclass which checks if specified uri is valid.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Import.HtmlExternalResolver.ResolveUri(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the absolute URI from the base and relative URIs.
member.param: Relative URI to the linked object.
member.returns: Absolute URI or null if the relative URI cannot be resolved.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Import.HtmlExternalResolver.GetEntity(System.String)
member.summary: Maps a URI to an object containing the actual resource.
member.returns: A object or null if resource cannot be streamed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Import.ExternalResourceResolver
member.summary: Callback class used to resolve external resources during Html, Svg documents import. Using this resolver could create a vulnerability when client provided HTML or SVG file will make server software to obtain local or network file. Use with caution. member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.ResetLicense
member.summary: Reset the license
member.remarks: Use this method to reset license in component

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.IsLicensed
member.summary: Check if licence is applied to component
member.returns: True if component is licensed, otherwise false

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BaseSlide.GetHashCode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a hash code for the slide.
member.param: 1. Calling with unique = true Returning value is calculated based on slide's structure, SlideId and presentation properties. Resulting hash code can be used for slide identification.In this mode returning value will be unique for every slide within one presentation and for every slide in different presentations unless these presentations are complete clones of each other (one is a pure copy of another without any further modifications). 2. Calling with unique = false Returning value is calculated based on slide's structure only. This mode is useful to find identical slides / layout slides / master slides as the result is equal for slides with the same structure.
member.returns: A SHA1 hash code for the slide.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BaseSlide.Equals(Aspose.Slides.IBaseSlide)
member.summary: Determines whether the two IBaseSlide instances are equal. Returning value is calculated based on slide's structure and static content. Two slides are equal if all shapes, styles, texts, animation and other settings. etc. are equal. The comparison doesn't take into account unique identifier values, e.g. SlideId and dynamic content, e.g. current date value in Date Placeholder.
member.param: The IBaseSlide to compare with the current IBaseSlide.
member.returns: true if the specified IBaseSlide is equal to the current IBaseSlide; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: This class contains the paragraph formatting properties. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate paragraph formatting properties defined for the particular paragraph. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.PortionFormat
member.summary: This class contains the text portion formatting properties. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate text portion formatting properties defined for the particular portion. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified slide to the end of the collection.
member.remarks: When cloning a slide between different presentations slide's master can be cloned too. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered. If you need more control over cloning process use or for cloning slides, or for cloning layouts and for cloning masters.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified source slide to the end of the collection. Appropriate layout will be selected automatically from the specified master (appropriate layout is the layout with the same Type or Name as of layout of the source slide). If there is no appropriate layout then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.param: Master slide for a new slide.

If there is no appropriate layout in specified master then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.exception: Thrown if there is no appropriate layout in specified master and allowCloneMissingLayout is false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified source slide to specified position of the collection. Appropriate layout will be selected automatically from the specified master (appropriate layout is the layout with the same Type or Name as of layout of the source slide). If there is no appropriate layout then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.param: Master slide for a new slide.

If there is no appropriate layout in specified master then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.exception: Thrown if there is no appropriate layout in specified master and allowCloneMissingLayout is false.

member.returns:
A 32-bit integer that indicates the relative order of the comparands. The return value has these meanings:
< 0 - This instance is less than obj.
= 0 - This instance is equal to obj.
> 0 - This instance is greater than obj.

member.summary: Returns the color format of a bullet of a paragraph with no inheritance. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns or sets the first number which is used for group of numbered bullets with no inheritance. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines whether the bullet has own color or inherits it from the first portion in the paragraph. NullableBool.True if bullet has own color and NullableBool.False if bullet inherits color from the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BulletFormat.IsBulletHardFont
member.summary: Determines whether the bullet has own font or inherits it from the first portion in the paragraph. NullableBool.True if bullet has own font and NullableBool.False if bullet inherits font from the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns the picture used as a bullet in a paragraph with no inheritance. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BulletFormat.ApplyDefaultParagraphIndentsShifts
member.summary: Sets default non-zero shifts for effective paragraph Indent and MarginLeft when bullets is enabled (like PowerPoint do if enable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). If bullets is disabled then just reset paragraph Indent and MarginLeft (like PowerPoint do if disable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). Indents shifts are applied in regard to current bullet context - IBulletFormat.Type, .NumberedBulletStyle and FontHeight of first portion. Non-zero indents shifts are applied to effective Indent and MarginLeft of current paragraph (make result values to be local values).

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager
member.summary: Presentation password protestion management.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.EncryptDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation is password protected. If true then document properties is encrypted in presentation file. If false then document properties is public while presentation is encrypted. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is encrypted. Read-only .
member.value: true if presentation was loaded from encrypted file or method was called ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected and document properties of this file are public. Value of true means that only document properties are loaded from an encrypted presentation file without use of password. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation is loaded with use of right password, not only document properties are loaded. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always false. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public then property value is always false. If Presentation.EncryptDocumentProperties is true than IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded property value is always false. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsWriteProtected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this presentation is write protected. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts Presentation with specified password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.RemoveEncryption
member.summary: Removes the encryption.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.SetWriteProtection(System.String)
member.summary: Set write protection for this presentation with specified password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.RemoveWriteProtection
member.summary: Removes write protection for this presentation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.EncryptionPassword
member.summary: Gets the password which is used for presentation encryption. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Animation.IPoint.Formula
member.summary:
Formulas within values, from, to, by attributes can be made up of these: Standard arithmetic operators: +, -, *, /, ^, % (mod) Constants: pi e Conditional operators: abs, min, max, ? (if) Comparison operators: '==', '>=', '', '!=', '!' Trigonometric operators: sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan() Natural logarithm ln() Property references (host supported properties)
for example: "#ppt_x+(cos(-2*pi*(1-$))*-#ppt_x-sin(-2*pi*(1-$))*(1-#ppt_y))*(1-$)" Read/write .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.CombinableSeriesTypesGroup
member.summary: Enumeration of groups of combinable series types. Each element relates to group of types of chart series that can persist simultaneously in one ChartSeriesGroup. For example: ChartType.PercentsStackedArea series cannot be simultaneously with ChartType.StackedArea series in one ChartSeriesGroup. But two or more ChartType.PercentsStackedArea can be in one ChartSeriesGroup simultaneously (CombinableSeriesTypesGroup.AreaChart_PercentsStackedArea). And ChartType.Line series can be with ChartType.LineWithMarkers series simultaneously in one CombinableSeriesTypesGroup.LineChart_Line ChartSeriesGroup.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IErrorBarsCustomValues.YMinus
member.summary: Specifies the error bar value in the negative direction. Avalible if error bars value type is Custom and ErrorBarsYFormat is allowed. In any other case this property returns null. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IErrorBarsCustomValues.XPlus
member.summary: Specifies the error bar value in the positive direction. Avalible if error bars value type is Custom and ErrorBarsXFormat is allowed. In any other case this property returns null. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IErrorBarsCustomValues.YPlus
member.summary: Specifies the error bar value in the positive direction. Avalible if error bars value type is Custom and ErrorBarsYFormat is allowed. In any other case this property returns null. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.PieSplitType
member.summary: Represents a type of splitting points in the second pie or bar on a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.PieSplitType.Default
member.summary: Specifies the data points shall be split using the default mechanism for this chart type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.PieSplitType.Custom
member.summary: Specifies the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart according to the Custom Split values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.PieSplitType.ByPercentage
member.summary: Specifies the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the points with percentage less than Split Position percent in the second chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.PieSplitType.ByPos
member.summary: Specifies the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the last Split Position of the data points in the second chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.PieSplitType.ByValue
member.summary: Specifies the data points shall be split between the pie and the second chart by putting the data points with value less than Split Position in the second chart.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickLabelPositionType
member.summary: Represents the position type of tick-mark labels on the specified axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickLabelPositionType.High
member.summary: Specifies the axis labels shall be at the high end of the perpendicular axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickLabelPositionType.Low
member.summary: Specifies the axis labels shall be at the low end of the perpendicular axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickLabelPositionType.NextTo
member.summary: Specifies the axis labels shall be next to the axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickLabelPositionType.None
member.summary: Specifies the axis labels are not drawn.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickMarkType
member.summary: Represents the tick mark type for the specified axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickMarkType.Cross
member.summary: Specifies the tick marks shall cross the axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickMarkType.Inside
member.summary: Specifies the tick marks shall be inside the plot area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickMarkType.None
member.summary: Specifies there shall be no tick marks.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TickMarkType.Outside
member.summary: Specifies the tick marks shall be outside the plot area.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TimeUnitType
member.summary: Represents the base unit for the category axis

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TimeUnitType.Days
member.summary: Specifies the chart data shall be shown in days.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TimeUnitType.Months
member.summary: Specifies the chart data shall be shown in months.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TimeUnitType.Years
member.summary: Specifies the chart data shall be shown in years.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TrendlineType
member.summary: Represents type of trend line

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TrendlineType.Exponential
member.summary: Specifies the trendline shall be an exponential curve in the form.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TrendlineType.Linear
member.summary: Specifies the trendline shall be a line in the form.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TrendlineType.Logarithmic
member.summary: Specifies the trendline shall be a logarithmic curve in the form , where log is the natural logarithm.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TrendlineType.MovingAverage
member.summary: Specifies the trendline shall be a moving average of period Period.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TrendlineType.Polynomial
member.summary: Specifies the trendline shall be a polynomial curve of order Order in the form.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.TrendlineType.Power
member.summary: Specifies the trendline shall be a power curve in the form.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.MarkerStyleType

member.summary: Specifies a circle shall be drawn at each data point.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.MarkerStyleType.Dash

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.MarkerStyleType.None
member.summary: Specifies nothing shall be drawn at each data point.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.MarkerStyleType.Picture
member.summary: Specifies a picture shall be drawn at each data point.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.Charts.MarkerStyleType.Plus
member.summary: Specifies a plus shall be drawn at each data point.

member.summary: Gets properties of the legend entry corresponding to Chart.ChartData.Series[0].DataPoints[index] in case of chart type from this list: ChartType.BarOfPie, ChartType.ExplodedPie, ChartType.ExplodedPie3D, ChartType.Pie, ChartType.Pie3D, ChartType.PieOfPie; or corresponding to Chart.ChartData.Series[index] for other chart types.

member.summary: Gets the number of elements actually contained in the collection. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline
member.summary: Class represents trend line of chart series

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.TrendlineName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the trendline. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.TrendlineType
member.summary: Gets or sets type of trend line. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.Format
member.summary: Represents the format of the trend line. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.Backward
member.summary: Specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trend line extends before the data for the series that is being trended. On scatter and non-scatter charts, the value shall be any nonnegative value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.Forward
member.summary: Specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends after the data for the series that is being trended. On scatter and non-scatter charts, the value shall be any non-negative value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.Intercept
member.summary: Specifies the value where the trendline shall cross the y axis. This property shall be supported only when the trendline type is exp, linear, or poly. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.DisplayEquation
member.summary: Specifies that the equation for the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the Rsquaredvalue). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.Order
member.summary: Specifies the order of the polynomial trend line. It is ignored for other trend line types. Value must be between 2 and 6. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.Period
member.summary: Specifies the period of the trend line for a moving average trend line. It is ignored for other trend line variants. Value must be between 2 and 255. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.DisplayRSquaredValue
member.summary: Specifies that the R-squared value of the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the equation). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.RelatedLegendEntry
member.summary: Represents legend entry related with this trendline Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ITrendline.AsIOverridableText
member.summary: Returns IOverridableText interface. Read-only .
member.remarks: For COM compatibility.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IOverridableText.TextFrameForOverriding
member.summary: Can contain a rich formatted text. If this property is not null then this formatted text value overrides auto-generated text. Auto-generated text is an implicit property of the data label, the display unit label of the value axis, the axis title, the chart title, the label of the trendline. Auto-generated text is formatted with the IFormattedTextContainer.TextFormat property. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IOverridableText.AddTextFrameForOverriding(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize TextFrameForOverriding with the text in paramener "text". If TextFrameForOverriding is already initialized then simply changes its text.

member.summary: Allows to get base IFormattedTextContainer interface. Read-only .

member.summary: Specifies whether AsCell or AsLiteralString or AsLiteralDouble property is actual in data points Value property object. In other words it specifies the type of value of ChartDataPoint.Value.Data property. Read/write .

member.summary: Specifies the type of values in ChartDataPoint.ErrorBarsCustomValues properties list Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartDataPointCollection.GetOrCreateDataPointByIdx(System.UInt32)
member.summary: If collection already contains data point with index then returns this data point. If collection doesn't contains data point with index ==N (when number of data points in this collection is less or equal then N) then adds deficient data points and returns last (which has requested index). For example, collection indexes are {0, 1, 2}, and requested index is 5. Then method adds deficient data points: {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5}. And returns data point with index 5.
member.returns: Returns data point with requested index.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeriesGroupCollection
member.summary: Represents the coleection of groups of combinable series.
member.remarks:
1) Each group of series contains series with combinable types. Groups of combinable series types defined and described with CombinableSeriesTypesGroup enum. Also each group of series contains series witch is plotted whether on primary axes or on secondary axes (not both cases in one group). So, principle of series grouping is a grouping by type groups mentioned above and by primary/secondary plotting type.
2) Group of series contains some series properies whitch is common for each series in group ("series group properties"). "Series group properties" in ChartSeriesGroup class is read/write. Each of "series group properties" can have a read-only projection in ChartSeries class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeriesGroupCollection.Item(Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries)
member.summary: Gets the series group by series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeriesGroupCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the series group by index.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeriesGroup
member.summary: Represents group of series.
member.remarks: 1) See summary and remarks for ChartSeriesGroupCollection class and CombinableSeriesTypesGroup enum. 2) Group of series contains some series properies whitch is common for each series in group ("series group properties"). "Series group properties" in ChartSeriesGroup class is read/write. Each of "series group properties" can have a read-only projection in ChartSeries class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IDataLabelFormat.IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource
member.summary: Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IDataLabel.IsVisible
member.summary: False means that data label is not visible (and so all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) are false). Read-only .
member.remarks: If data label is visible you can make it hidden with Hide() method. But if data label is not visible (IsVisible is false) you can make data label visible with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to true state.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IDataLabel.Hide
member.summary: Make data label hidden by setting all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to false state. IsVisible will be false after this.
member.remarks: If data label is not visible (IsVisible is false) you can make data label visible with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to true state.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IDataLabelCollection.Hide

member.remarks: If data label is not visible by default (IsVisible is false) you can make data label "visible by default" with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) of the DefaultDataLabelFormat property to true state.

member.summary: Represents chart categories.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartCategory.UseCell
member.summary: If true then AsCell property is actual. In other words, worksheet is used for storing category (this case supports a multi-level category). If false then AsLiteral property is actual. In other words, worksheet is NOT used for storing category (and this case doesn't support a multi-level categories). Read-only .
member.remarks: For change value of this property (for all categories in collection) set new value to ChartCategoryCollection.UseCells property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartCategory.AsCell
member.summary: Returns or sets Aspose.Cells.Cell object. If category is multi-level then used Aspose.Cells.Cell object for level "0". Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartCategory.AsLiteral
member.summary: Returns or sets AsLiteral if UseCell is false. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartCategory.Value
member.summary: If UseCell is true then this property represents AsCell.Value property. If UseCell is false then this property represents AsLiteral property. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartCategory.GroupingLevels
member.summary: Managed container of the values of the chart category grouping levels. Multi-level category contain more then one grouping level. Grouping levels indexing is zero-based. Read-only .

member.summary: Removes category from chart.
member.exception: Thrown if category is already removed from chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.ErrorBarsXFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection X.
ErrorBars with X direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).
Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.ErrorBarsYFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection Y.
ErrorBars with Y direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, line, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).
Read-only .

member.summary: Indicates if this series is plotted on second value axis. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the number format for series values. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the number format for series x values. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the number format for series bubble sizes. Read/write .
