member.summary: Specifies the bar, column or bubble series shall invert its colors if the value is negative. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.InvertedSolidFillColor
member.summary: Specifies invert solid color for series. To apply color setting set series format FillType to FillType.Solid. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.RelatedLegendEntry
member.summary: Represents legend entry related with this series Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.GetAutomaticSeriesColor
member.summary: Returns an automatic color of series based on series index and chart style. This color is used by default if FillType equals NotDefined.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.HasUpDownBars
member.summary: Determines whether Line- or Stock-chart has a up/down bars. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars.HasUpDownBars read/write property for change value. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars property for format up/down bars. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars.HasUpDownBars.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.GapWidth
member.summary: Specifies the space between bar or column clusters, as a percentage of the bar or column width. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.GapWidth read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.GapWidth.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.GapDepth
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance, as a percentage of the marker width, between the data series in a 3D chart. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.GapDepth read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.GapDepth.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.IsColorVaried
member.summary: Specifies that each data marker in the series has a different color. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.IsColorVaried read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.IsColorVaried.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.HasSeriesLines
member.summary: Determines whether there are series lines for this series and kindred series. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.HasSeriesLines read/write property for change value. Use ParentSeriesGroup.SeriesLinesFormat property for format series lines. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.HasSeriesLines.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.Overlap
member.summary: Specifies how much bars and columns shall overlap on 2-D charts (from -100 to 100). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.Overlap read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.Overlap.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.SecondPieSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the second pie or bar of a pie-of-pie chart or a bar-of-pie chart, as a percentage of the size of the first pie (can be between 5 and 200 percents). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.SecondPieSize read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.SecondPieSize.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.PieSplitPosition
member.summary: Specifies a value that shall be used to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart. Is used together with PieSplitBy property. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitPosition read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitPosition.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.PieSplitBy
member.summary: Specifies how to determine which data points are in the second pie or bar on a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitBy read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: 1) This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitBy. 2) If property value is PieSplitBy.Custom then you can define custom split information with ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitCustomPoints property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.DoughnutHoleSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the hole in a doughnut chart (can be between 10 and 90 percents of the size of the plot area.). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.DoughnutHoleSize read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.DoughnutHoleSize.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.FirstSliceAngle
member.summary: Specifies the angle of the first pie or doughnut chart slice, in degrees (clockwise from up, from 0 to 360 degrees). This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.FirstSliceAngle read/write property for change value. Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.FirstSliceAngle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartSeries.PieSplitCustomPoints
member.summary: The custom split information for a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart with a custom split. Contains data points that shall be drawn in the second pie or bar in a pie-of-pie or bar-of-pie chart. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property Read-only .
member.remarks: This is the projection of the property ParentSeriesGroup.PieSplitCustomPoints.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartData
member.summary: Represents data used for a chart plotting.

member.summary: Gets the cells factory to create cells used for chart series or categories. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartData.Series
member.summary: Gets the series. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartData.SeriesGroups
member.summary: Gets the groups of series. Read-only .
member.remarks:
1) Each group of series contains series with combinable types. Groups of combinable series types defined and described with CombinableSeriesTypesGroup enum. Also each group of series contains series witch is plotted whether on primary axes or on secondary axes (not both cases in one group). So, principle of series grouping is a grouping by type groups mentioned above and by primary/secondary plotting type.
2) Group of series contains some series properies whitch is common for each series in group ("series group properties"). "Series group properties" in ChartSeriesGroup class is read/write. Each of "series group properties" can have a read-only projection in ChartSeries class.

member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation degree around the X-axis, i.e. in the Y direction for 3D charts (between -90 and 90 degrees). The property matches with the 21.2.2.157 rotX (X Rotation) item in ECMA-376 and with the "Y Rotation" option in PowerPoint 2007+. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IRotation3D.RotationY
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation degree around the Y-axis, i.e. in the X direction for 3D charts (between 0 and 360 degrees). The property matches with the 21.2.2.158 rotY (Y Rotation) item in ECMA-376 and with the "X Rotation" option in PowerPoint 2007+. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines whether the chart axes are at right angles, rather than drawn in perspective. In other words it determines whether the chart angles of axes are independent from chart rotation or elevation. Read/write .

member.summary: Specifies the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent). Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets vertical anchor text in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.CenterText
member.summary: If NullableBool.True then text should be centered in box horizontally. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.TextVerticalType
member.summary: Determines text orientation. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and custom angle in property RotationAngle. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.MarginLeft
member.summary: Returns or sets the left margin (points) in a TextFrame. Changing of this property can produce a certain influence only for these chart parts: DataLabel and DataLabelFormat (full suport in PowerPoint 2013; in PowerPoint 2007 there is no effect for rendering). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.MarginRight
member.summary: Returns or sets the right margin (points) in a TextFrame. Changing of this property can produce a certain influence only for these chart parts: DataLabel and DataLabelFormat (full suport in PowerPoint 2013; in PowerPoint 2007 there is no effect for rendering). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.MarginTop
member.summary: Returns or sets the top margin (points) in a TextFrame. Changing of this property can produce a certain influence only for these chart parts: DataLabel and DataLabelFormat (full suport in PowerPoint 2013; in PowerPoint 2007 there is no effect for rendering). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.MarginBottom
member.summary: Returns or sets the bottom margin (points) in a TextFrame. Changing of this property can produce a certain influence only for these chart parts: DataLabel and DataLabelFormat (full suport in PowerPoint 2013; in PowerPoint 2007 there is no effect for rendering). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.WrapText
member.summary: True if text is wrapped at TextFrame's margins. Changing of this property can produce a certain influence only for these chart parts: DataLabel and DataLabelFormat (full suport in PowerPoint 2007/2013). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.AutofitType
member.summary: Returns or sets text's autofit mode. Changing of this property can produce a certain influence only for these chart parts: DataLabel and DataLabelFormat (full suport in PowerPoint 2013; in PowerPoint 2007 there is no effect for rendering). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextBlockFormat.RotationAngle
member.summary: Specifies the custom rotation that is being applied to the text within the bounding box. If it not specified, the rotation of the accompanying shape is used. If it is specified, then this is applied independently from the shape. That is the shape can have a rotation applied in addition to the text itself having a rotation applied to it. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and predefined vertical type in property TextVerticalType. Read/write .
member.example: Consider the case where a shape has a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise applied to it. In addition to this, the text body itself has a rotation of -90 degrees counter-clockwise applied to it. Then the resulting shape would appear to be rotated but the text within it would appear as though it had not been rotated at all.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.IChartTextFormat

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Export.ILinkEmbedController
member.summary: Callback interface used to determine how object should be processed during saving.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Export.ILinkEmbedController.GetObjectStoringLocation(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines where object should be stored. This method is called once for each object id. It is not guaranteed that there won't be two objects with same data, semanticName and contentType but with different id.
member.param: Object id. This id is saving operation-wide unique.
Object binary data. This parameter can be null, if object binary data is not generated yet.

Some short text, describing meaning of object. Controller may use this as a part of external object name, but it is up to dispatcher to ensure that names will be unique and contain only allowed characters.
File name extension, recommended for this MIME type.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Export.ILinkEmbedController.GetUrl(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an URL to an external object. This method always called if returned and may be called if returned but embedding is impossible. Can be called multiple time for same object id.
member.param: Object id. This id is saving operation-wide unique.
id of referrencing object or 0, if object is referrenced by the root document. May be used to generate relative link.
member.returns: Url of external object or null if this object should be ignored.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Export.ILinkEmbedController.SaveExternal(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Saves external object.
member.param: Object id. This id is saving operation-wide unique.

member.summary: SVG 1.1 lacks ability to define insets for markers. Aspose.Slides SVG writing engine has workaround for that problem: it crops end of line with arrow, so, line doesn't overlap markers. This option switches off such behavior. Read/write .

member.summary: Provides options that control how a presentation is saved in Pdf format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.TextCompression
member.summary: Specifies compression type to be used for all textual content in the document. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.EmbedTrueTypeFontsForASCII
member.summary: True to embed true type fonts for ASCII characters 32-127. Fonts for character codes greater than 127 are always embedded. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.ShowHiddenSlides
member.summary: Specifies whether the generated document should include hidden slides or not. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.AdditionalCommonFontFamilies
member.summary: Returns or sets an array of user-defined names of font families which Aspose.Slides should consider common. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.EmbedFullFonts
member.summary: Determines if all characters of font should be embedded or only used subset. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Returns or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside PDF document. Read/write .

remarks.p: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in PDF format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.
The default value is 100.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.Compliance
member.summary: Desired conformance level for generated PDF document. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.Password
member.summary: Setting user password to protect the PDF document. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.SaveMetafilesAsPng
member.summary: True to convert all metafiles used in a presentation to the PNG images. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is true. Pdf document can contain vector graphics and raster images. If SaveMetafilesAsPng is set to true then source Metafile image is converted to Png format and saved to Pdf as a raster image. If SaveMetafilesAsPng is set to false then source Metafile is converted to Pdf vector graphics. Each approach has advantages and disadvantages.For example, if Metafile is converted to PNG, then some quality loss is possible during resulting document scaling.If Metafile is converted to Pdf vector graphics, then performance issues in Pdf viewing tool are possible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.SufficientResolution
member.summary:
Returns or sets a value determining resolution of images inside PDF document.
Property affects on file size, time of export and image quality.
The default value is 96.Effect of this parameter depends on few factors. Algorithm tries to get best output image size according to the property value, source image size and image frame size. Using of similar property values may give the same result. Recommended to use step 16 or 32 to get visible effect. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.DrawSlidesFrame
member.summary: True to draw black frame around each slide. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.IPdfOptions.IncludeComments
member.summary: True to insert comment pages into generated PDF. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.summary: Provides options that control how notes and comments is placed in exported document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.IMasterLayoutSlideCollection
member.summary: Represents a collections of all layout slides of defined master slide. Extends ILayoutSlideCollection interface with methods for adding/inserting/removing/cloning layout slides in context of the individual collections of master's layout slides.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IMasterLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the end of the collection.
member.remarks: 1) New layout will be linked with parent master slide for this layout slides collection. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IMasterLayoutSlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified layout slide to specified position of the collection.
member.remarks: New layout will be linked with parent master slide for this layout slides collection. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IMasterLayoutSlideCollection.Add(Aspose.Slides.SlideLayoutType,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new layout slide to the end of the collection.
member.param: Layout type for a new layout. Supported layout types: Title, TitleOnly, Blank, TitleAndObject, VerticalText, VerticalTitleAndText, TwoObjects, SectionHeader, TwoTextAndTwoObjects, TitleObjectAndCaption, PictureAndCaption, Custom. Other layout types are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

Name for a new layout. If passed name is already in use the ArgumentException will be thrown. If null parameter is passed then name genarated atomatically in regards to passed layout type (for example "Title Slide" or "1_Title Slide", "2_..", etc.).
member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.
Thrown if layout name value is already in use in this collection of the layouts.
member.remarks: 1) Added layout for value SlideLayoutType.Custom of contains no placeholders and no shapes. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IMasterLayoutSlideCollection.Insert(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.SlideLayoutType,System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a new layout slide to specified position of the collection.
member.param: Layout type for a new layout. Supported layout types: Title, TitleOnly, Blank, TitleAndObject, VerticalText, VerticalTitleAndText, TwoObjects, SectionHeader, TwoTextAndTwoObjects, TitleObjectAndCaption, PictureAndCaption, Custom. Other layout types are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

Name for a new layout. If passed name is already in use the ArgumentException will be thrown. If null parameter is passed then name genarated atomatically in regards to passed layout type (for example "Title Slide" or "1_Title Slide", "2_..", etc.).
member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.
Thrown if layout name value is already in use in this collection of the layouts.
member.remarks: Inserted layout for value SlideLayoutType.Custom of contains no placeholders and no shapes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IMasterLayoutSlideCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index of the collection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to remove.
member.exception: Thrown if layout is used in presentation (its HasDependingSlides property is true).
member.remarks: 1) To avoid throwing of the PptxEditException check layout's HasDependingSlides property before. 2) You can use also method to simplify code.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.IGlobalLayoutSlideCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of all layout slides in presentation. Extends ILayoutSlideCollection interface with methods for adding/cloning layout slides in context of uniting of the individual collections of master's layout slides.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IGlobalLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the presentation.
member.remarks: When cloning a layout between different presentations layout's master can be cloned too to keep source formatting. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IGlobalLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the presentation.
member.param: Master slide for a new layout.
member.remarks: New layout will be linked with defined master in destination presentation. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint.

member.param: Master slide for a new layout.

Layout type for a new layout. Supported layout types: Title, TitleOnly, Blank, TitleAndObject, VerticalText, VerticalTitleAndText, TwoObjects, SectionHeader, TwoTextAndTwoObjects, TitleObjectAndCaption, PictureAndCaption, Custom. Other layout types are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

Name for a new layout. If passed name is already in use the ArgumentException will be thrown. If null parameter is passed then name genarated atomatically in regards to passed layout type (for example "Title Slide" or "1_Title Slide", "2_..", etc.).
member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.
Thrown if is null.
Thrown if belongs to the other presentation.
Thrown if layout name value is already in use in collection of the layouts of .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.IBasePortionFormat
member.summary: This class contains the text portion formatting properties. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate text portion formatting properties defined for the particular portion. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBasePortionFormat.LineFormat
member.summary: Returns the LineFormatEx properties for text outlining. No inheritance applied. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns the text FillFormatEx properties. No inheritance applied. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns the text EffectFormatEx properties. No inheritance applied. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns the LineFormatEx properties used to outline underline line. No inheritance applied. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBasePortionFormat.UnderlineFillFormat
member.summary: Returns the underline line FillFormatEx properties. No inheritance applied. Read-only .

member.summary: Determines whether the font is itallic. No inheritance applied. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines whether the numbers should ignore text eastern language-specific vertical text layout. No inheritance applied. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines whether the height of a text should be normalized. No inheritance applied. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines whether the text shouldn't be proofed. No inheritance applied. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the text underline type. No inheritance applied. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the type of text capitalization. No inheritance applied. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the strikethrough type of a text. No inheritance applied. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines whether the underline style has own LineFormat properties or inherits it from the LineFormat properties of the text. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBasePortionFormat.IsHardUnderlineFill
member.summary: Determines whether the underline style has own FillFormat properties or inherits it from the FillFormat properties of the text. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the font height of a portion. float.NaN means height is undefined and should be inherited from the Master. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the Latin font info. Null means font is undefined and should be inherited from the Master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBasePortionFormat.EastAsianFont
member.summary: Returns or sets the East Asian font info. Null means font is undefined and should be inherited from the Master. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the complex script font info. Null means font is undefined and should be inherited from the Master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBasePortionFormat.SymbolFont
member.summary: Returns or sets the symbolic font info. Null means font is undefined and should be inherited from the Master. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the superscript or subscript text. Value from -100% (subscript) to 100% (superscript). float.NaN means value is undefined and should be inherited from the Master. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets the minimal font size, for which kerning should be switched on. float.NaN means value is undefined and should be inherited from the Master. Read/write .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType
member.summary: Represents layout type of a SmartArt diagram.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.AccentProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression, a timeline, or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works well for illustrating both Level 1 and Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.AccentedPicture
member.summary: Use to show a central, photographic idea with related ideas on the side. The top Level 1 text appears over the central picture. Corresponding text for other Level 1 shapes appear next to the small circular pictures. This layout also works well with no text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.AlternatingFlow
member.summary: Use to show groups of information or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Emphasizes the interaction or relationships among the groups of information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.AlternatingHexagons
member.summary: Use to represent a series of interconnected ideas. Level 1 text appears inside the hexagons. Level 2 text appears outside the shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.AlternatingPictureBlocks
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures from top to bottom. Text appears alternately on the right or left of the picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.AlternatingPictureCircles
member.summary: Use to show a set of pictures with text. The corresponding text appears in the central circles with the images alternating from left to right.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ArrowRibbon
member.summary: Use to show either related or contrasting concepts with some connection, such as opposing forces. The first two lines of Level 1 text are used for text in the arrows. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.AscendingPictureAccentProcess
member.summary: Use to show an ascending series of pictures with descriptive text. Works best with a small amount of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.Balance
member.summary: Use to compare or show the relationship between two ideas. Each of the first two lines of Level 1 text corresponds to text at the top of one side of the center point. Emphasizes Level 2 text, which is limited to four shapes on each side of the center point. The balance tips towards the side with the most shapes containing Level 2 text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicBendingProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicBlockList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicChevronProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression; a timeline; sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow; or to emphasize movement or direction. Level 1 text appears inside an arrow shape while Level 2 text appears below the arrow shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicCycle
member.summary: Use to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the stages or steps rather than the connecting arrows or flow. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicMatrix
member.summary: Use to show the relationship of components to a whole in quadrants. The first four lines of Level 1 text appear in the quadrants. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicPie
member.summary: Use to show how individual parts form a whole. The first seven lines of Level 1 text correspond to the evenly distributed wedge or pie shapes. The top Level 1 text shape appears outside of the rest of the pie for emphasis. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicPyramid
member.summary: Use to show proportional, interconnected, or hierarchical relationships with the largest component on the bottom and narrowing up. Level 1 text appears in the pyramid segments and Level 2 text appears in shapes alongside each segment.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicRadial
member.summary: Use to show the relationship to a central idea in a cycle. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central shape, and its Level 2 text corresponds to the surrounding circular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicTarget
member.summary: Use to show containment, gradations, or hierarchical relationships. The first five lines of Level 1 text are associated with a circle. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicTimeline
member.summary: Use to show sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow, or to show timeline information. Works well with both Level 1 and Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BasicVenn
member.summary: Use to show overlapping or interconnected relationships. The first seven lines of Level 1 text correspond with a circle. If there are four or fewer lines of Level 1 text, the text is inside the circles. If there are more than four lines of Level 1 text, the text is outside of the circles. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BendingPictureAccentList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The small circular shapes are designed to contain pictures. Works well for illustrating both Level 1 and Level 2 text. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BendingPictureBlocks
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures. The box covering the bottom corner can contain small amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BendingPictureCaption
member.summary: Use to show a sequential series of pictures. The box covering the bottom corner can contain small amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BendingPictureCaptionList
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures. The title and description appear in a callout shape under each picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BendingPictureSemiTransparentText
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures. A semi-transparent box covers the lower portion of the picture and contains all levels of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BlockCycle
member.summary: Use to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the stages or steps rather than the connecting arrows or flow.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.BubblePictureList
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures. Can contain up to eight Level 1 pictures. Unused text and pictures do not appear, but remain available if you switch layouts. Works best with small amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CaptionedPictures
member.summary: Use to show pictures with multiple levels of text. Works best with a small amount of Level 1 text and a medium amount of Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ChevronList
member.summary: Use to show a progression through several processes that make up an overall workflow. Also works for illustrating contrasting processes. The Level 1 text corresponds to the first arrow shape on the left, while the Level 2 text corresponds to horizontal sub-steps for each shape that contains Level 1 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CircleAccentTimeline
member.summary: Use to show a series of events or timeline information. Level 1 text appears next to larger circular shapes. Level 2 text appears next to smaller circular shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CircleArrowProcess
member.summary: Use to show sequential items with supporting text for each item. This diagram works best with small amounts of Level 1 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CirclePictureHierarchy
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical information or reporting relationships in an organization. Pictures appear in circles and corresponding text appears next to the pictures.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CircleRelationship
member.summary: Use to show the relationship to or from a central idea. Level 2 text is added non-sequentially and is limited to five items. There can only be one Level 1 item.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CircularBendingProcess
member.summary: Use to show a long or non-linear sequence or steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works best with Level 1 text only. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CircularPictureCallout
member.summary: Use to show a central idea and sub-ideas or related items. The text for the first picture covers the lower portion of the picture. The corresponding text for other Level 1 shapes appears next to the small circular pictures. This diagram also works well with no text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ClosedChevronProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression, a timeline, or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow, or to emphasize movement or direction. Can be used to emphasize information in the starting shape. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ContinuousArrowProcess
member.summary: Use to show a timeline or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works best with Level 1 text because each line of Level 1 text appears inside the arrow shape. Level 2 text appears outside the arrow shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ContinuousBlockProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works best with minimal Level 1 and Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ContinuousCycle
member.summary: Use to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the connection between all components. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ContinuousPictureList
member.summary: Use to show groups of interconnected information. The circular shapes are designed to contain pictures.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ConvergingArrows
member.summary: Use to show ideas or concepts that converge to a central point. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ConvergingRadial
member.summary: Use to show relationships of concepts or components to a central idea in a cycle. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central circular shape and the lines of Level 2 text correspond to the surrounding rectangular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CounterbalanceArrows
member.summary: Use to show two opposing ideas or concepts. Each of the first two lines of Level 1 text corresponds to an arrow and works well with Level 2 text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.CycleMatrix
member.summary: Use to show the relationship to a central idea in a cyclical progression. Each of the first four lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a wedge or pie shape, and Level 2 text appears in a rectangular shape to the side of the wedge or pie shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.DescendingBlockList
member.summary: Use to show groups of related ideas or lists of information. The text shapes decrease in height sequentially, and the Level 1 text displays vertically.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.DescendingProcess
member.summary: Use to show a descending series of events. The first Level 1 text is at the top of arrow, and the last Level 1 text displays at the bottom of the arrow. Only the first seven Level 1 items appear. Works best with small to medium amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.DetailedProcess
member.summary: Use with large amounts of Level 2 text to show a progression through stages.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.DivergingArrows
member.summary: Use to show ideas or concepts that progress outward from a central source. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.DivergingRadial
member.summary: Use to show relationships to a central idea in a cycle. The first Level 1 line of text corresponds to the central circular shape. Emphasizes the surrounding circles rather than the central idea. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.Equation
member.summary: Use to show sequential steps or tasks that depict a plan or result. The last Level 1 line of text appears after the equals sign (=).Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.FramedTextPicture
member.summary: Use to show pictures with corresponding Level 1 text displayed in a frame.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.Funnel
member.summary: Use to show the filtering of information or how parts merge into a whole. Emphasizes the final outcome. Can contain up to four lines of Level 1 text; the last of these four Level 1 text lines appears below the funnel and the other lines correspond to a circular shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.Gear
member.summary: Use to show interlocking ideas. Each of the first three lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a gear shape, and their corresponding Level 2 text appears in rectangles next to the gear shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.GridMatrix
member.summary: Use to show the placement of concepts along two axes. Emphasizes the individual components rather than the whole. The first four lines of Level 1 text appear in the quadrants. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.GroupedList
member.summary: Use to show groups and sub-groups of information, or steps and sub-steps in a task, process, or workflow. Level 1 text corresponds to the top level horizontal shapes, and Level 2 text corresponds to vertical sub-steps under each related top level shape. Works well for emphasizing sub-groups or sub-steps, hierarchical information, or multiple lists of information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HalfCircleOrganizationChart
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical information or reporting relationships in an organization. The assistant shapes and Org Chart hanging layouts are available with this layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HexagonCluster
member.summary: Use to show pictures with associated descriptive text. Small hexagons indicate the picture and text pair. Works best with small amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.Hierarchy
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical relationships progressing from top to bottom.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HierarchyList
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical relationships progressing across groups. Can also be used to group or list information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HorizontalBulletList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped lists of information. Works well with large amounts of text. All text has the same level of emphasis, and direction is not implied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HorizontalHierarchy
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical relationships progressing horizontally. Works well for decision trees.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HorizontalLabeledHierarchy
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical relationships progressing horizontally and grouped hierarchically. Emphasizes heading or level 1 text. The first line of Level 1 text appears in the shape at the beginning of the hierarchy, and the second and all subsequent lines of Level 1 text appear at the top of the tall rectangles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HorizontalMultiLevelHierarchy
member.summary: Use to show large amounts of hierarchical information progressing horizontally. The top of the hierarchy is displayed vertically. This layout supports many levels in the hierarchy.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HorizontalOrganizationChart
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical information horizontally or reporting relationships in an organization. The assistant shape and the Org Chart hanging layouts are available with this layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.HorizontalPictureList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped information with an emphasis on related pictures. The top shapes are designed to contain pictures.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.IncreasingArrowsProcess
member.summary: Use to show sequential and overlapping steps in a process. Limited to five Level 1 items. Level 2 can contain large amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.IncreasingCircleProcess
member.summary: Use to show a series of steps, with the interior of the circle increasing with each step. Limited to seven Level 1 steps but unlimited Level 2 items. Works well with large amounts of Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.InvertedPyramid
member.summary: Use to show proportional, interconnected, or hierarchical relationships with the largest component on the top and narrowing down. Level 1 text appears in the pyramid segments and Level 2 text appears in shapes alongside each segment.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.LabeledHierarchy
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical relationships progressing from top to bottom and grouped hierarchically. Emphasizes heading or level 1 text. The first line of Level 1 text appears in the shape at the beginning of the hierarchy, and all subsequent lines of Level 1 text appear to the left of the long rectangles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.LinearVenn
member.summary: Use to show overlapping relationships in a sequence. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.LinedList
member.summary: Use to show large amounts of text divided into categories and subcategories. Works well with multiple levels of text. Text at the same level is separated by lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.MultidirectionalCycle
member.summary: Use to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events that can occur in any direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.NameandTitleOrganizationChart
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical information or reporting relationships in an organization. To enter text in the title box, type directly in the smaller rectangular shape. The assistant shape and Org Chart hanging layouts are available with this layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.NestedTarget
member.summary: Use to show containment relationships. Each of the first three lines of Level 1 text correspond to the upper left text in the shapes, and Level 2 text corresponds to the smaller shapes. Works best with minimal Level 2 lines of text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.NondirectionalCycle
member.summary: Use to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Each shape has the same level of importance. Works well when direction does not need to be indicated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.OpposingArrows
member.summary: Use to show two opposing ideas, or ideas that diverge from a central point. Each of the first two lines of Level 1 text corresponds to an arrow. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.OpposingIdeas
member.summary: Use to show two opposing or contrasting ideas. Can have one or two Level 1 items. Each Level 1 text can contain multiple sub-levels. Works well with large amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.OrganizationChart
member.summary: Use to show hierarchical information or reporting relationships in an organization. The assistant shape and the Org Chart hanging layouts are available with this layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PhasedProcess
member.summary: Use to show three phases of a process. Limited to three Level 1 items. The first two Level 1 items can each contain four Level 2 items, and the third Level 1 item can contain an unlimited number of Level 2 items. Works best with small amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PictureAccentBlocks
member.summary: Use to show a group of pictures in blocks starting from the corner. The corresponding text displays vertically. Works well as an accent on title or sub-title slides or for section breaks of a document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PictureAccentList
member.summary: Use to show grouped or related information. The small shapes on the upper corners are designed to contain pictures. Emphasizes Level 2 text over Level 1 text, and is a good choice for large amounts of Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PictureAccentProcess
member.summary: Use to show sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. The rectangular shapes in the background are designed to contain pictures.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PictureCaptionList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The top shapes are designed to contain pictures and pictures are emphasized over text. Works well for pictures with short text captions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PictureGrid
member.summary: Use to show pictures laid out on a square grid. Best with a small amount of Level 1 text, which appears above the picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PictureLineup
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures side by side. Level 1 text covers the top of the picture. Level 2 text appears below the picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PictureStrips
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures from top to bottom with Level 1 text beside each.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PieProcess
member.summary: Use to show steps in a process with each pie slice increasing in size up to seven shapes. Level 1 text displays vertically.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PlusandMinus
member.summary: Use to show the pros and cons of two ideas. Each Level 1 text can contain multiple sub-levels. Works well with large amounts of text. Limited to two Level 1 items.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ProcessArrows
member.summary: Use to show information illustrating a process or workflow. Level 1 text appears in the circular shapes and Level 2 text appears in the arrow shapes. Works best for minimal text and to emphasize movement or direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ProcessList
member.summary: Use to show multiple groups of information or steps and sub-steps in a task, process, or workflow. Level 1 text corresponds to the top horizontal shapes, and Level 2 text corresponds to vertical sub-steps under each related top level shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.PyramidList
member.summary: Use to show proportional, interconnected, or hierarchical relationships. Text appears in the rectangular shapes on top of the pyramid background.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.RadialCluster
member.summary: Use to show data that relates to a central idea or theme. The top Level 1 text appears in the center. Level 2 text appears in surrounding shapes. Can contain up to seven Level 2 shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts. Works best with small amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.RadialCycle
member.summary: Use to show the relationship to a central idea. Emphasizes both information in the center circle and how information in the outer ring of circles contributes to the central idea. The first Level 1 line of text corresponds to the central circle, and its Level 2 text corresponds to the outer ring of circles. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.RadialList
member.summary: Use to show relationships to a central idea in a cycle. The center shape can contain a picture. Level 1 text appears in the smaller circles and any related Level 2 text appears to the side of the smaller circles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.RadialVenn
member.summary: Use to show both overlapping relationships and the relationship to a central idea in a cycle. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central shape and the lines of Level 2 text correspond to the surrounding circular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.RandomToResultProcess
member.summary: Use to show, through a series of steps, how several chaotic ideas can result in a unified goal or idea. Supports multiple items of Level 1 text, but the first and last Level 1 corresponding shapes are fixed. Works best with small amounts of Level 1 text and medium amounts of Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.RepeatingBendingProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.ReverseList
member.summary: Use to change between two items. Only the first two items of text display, and each item can contain a large amount of text. Works well to show a change between two items or shift in order.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.SegmentedCycle
member.summary: Use to show a progression or a sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the interconnected pieces. Each of the first seven lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a wedge or pie shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.SegmentedProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Emphasizes Level 2 text, since each line appears in a separate shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.SegmentedPyramid
member.summary: Use to show containment, proportional, or interconnected relationships. The first nine lines of Level 1 text appear in the triangular shapes. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.SnapshotPictureList
member.summary: Use to show pictures with explanatory text. Level 2 text can display lists of information. Works well with a large amount of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.SpiralPicture
member.summary: Use to show a series of up to five pictures with corresponding Level 1 captions that spiral in to the center.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.SquareAccentList
member.summary: Use to show lists of information divided into categories. Level 2 text appears beside a small square shape. Works well with large amounts of Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.StackedList
member.summary: Use to show groups of information or steps in a task, process, or workflow. Circular shapes contain Level 1 text, and the corresponding rectangles contain Level 2 text. Works well for numerous details and minimal Level 1 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.StackedVenn
member.summary: Use to show overlapping relationships. A good choice for emphasizing growth or gradation. Works best with Level 1 text only. The first seven lines of Level 1 text correspond to a circular shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.StaggeredProcess
member.summary: Use to show a downward progression through stages. Each of the first five lines of Level 1 text corresponds with a rectangle. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.StepDownProcess
member.summary: Use to show a descending process with multiple steps and sub-steps. Works best with small amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.StepUpProcess
member.summary: Use to show an ascending series of steps or lists of information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.SubStepProcess
member.summary: Use to show a multi-step process with sub-steps between each instance of Level 1 text. Works best with small amounts of text and is limited to seven Level 1 steps. Each Level 1 step can have unlimited sub-steps.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TableHierarchy
member.summary: Use to show groups of information built from top to bottom, and the hierarchies within each group. This layout does not contain connecting lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TableList
member.summary: Use to show grouped or related information of equal value. The first Level 1 line of text corresponds to the top shape and its Level 2 text is used for the subsequent lists.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TargetList
member.summary: Use to show interrelated or overlapping information. Each of the first seven lines of Level 1 text appears in the rectangular shape. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts. Works well with both Level 1 and Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TextCycle
member.summary: Use to represent a continuing sequence of stages, tasks, or events in a circular flow. Emphasizes the arrows or flow rather than the stages or steps. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TitlePictureLineup
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures that each have their own title and description. Level 1 text appears in the box above the picture. Level 2 text appears below the picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TitledMatrix
member.summary: Use to show the relationships of four quadrants to a whole. The first line of Level 1 text corresponds to the central shape, and the first four lines of Level 2 text appear in the quadrants. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TitledPictureAccentList
member.summary: Use to show lists of information with an accent picture for each Level 2 text. Level 1 text displays in a separate box at the top of the list.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TitledPictureBlocks
member.summary: Use to show a series of pictures. Level 1 text appears above each picture. Level 2 text appears to the side and slightly overlapping each picture.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.TrapezoidList
member.summary: Use to show grouped or related information of equal value. Works well with large amounts of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.UpwardArrow
member.summary: Use to show a progression or steps that trend upward in a task, process, or workflow. Each of the first five lines of Level 1 text corresponds to a point on the arrow. Works best with minimal text. Unused text does not appear, but remains available if you switch layouts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalAccentList
member.summary: Use to show lists of information. Level 2 text appears in rectangular shapes over vertical chevrons. Emphasizes Level 2 text over Level 1 text, and is a good choice for medium amounts of Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalArrowList
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow that move toward a common goal. Works well for bulleted lists of information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalBendingProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow. Maximizes both horizontal and vertical display space for shapes. Places more emphasis on the interrelationships among the shapes than on direction or movement.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalBlockList
member.summary: Use to show groups of information or steps in a task, process, or workflow. Works well with large amounts of Level 2 text. A good choice for text with a main point and multiple sub-points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalBoxList
member.summary: Use to show several groups of information, especially groups with large amounts of Level 2 text. A good choice for bulleted lists of information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalBulletList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. Works well for lists with long headings or top level information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalChevronList
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow, or to emphasize movement or direction. Emphasizes Level 2 text over Level 1 text, and is a good choice for large amounts of Level 2 text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalCircleList
member.summary: Use to show sequential or grouped data. Works best for Level 1 text, which displays next to a large circular shape. Lower levels of text are separated with smaller circular shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalCurvedList
member.summary: Use to show a curved list of information. To add pictures to the accent circle shapes, apply a picture fill.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalEquation
member.summary: Use to show sequential steps or tasks that depict a plan or result. The last Level 1 line of text appears after the arrow. Works best with Level 1 text only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalPictureAccentList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The small circles are designed to contain pictures.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalPictureList
member.summary: Use to show non-sequential or grouped blocks of information. The small shapes on the left are designed to contain pictures.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.VerticalProcess
member.summary: Use to show a progression or sequential steps in a task, process, or workflow from top to bottom. Works best with Level 1 text, since the vertical space is limited.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtLayoutType.Custom
member.summary: Represents a SmartArt diagram with custom layout template

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType
member.summary: Represents style scheme of a SmartArt diagram.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.SimpleFill
member.summary: SimpleFill

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.WhiteOutline
member.summary: WhiteOutline

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.SubtleEffect
member.summary: SubtleEffect

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.ModerateEffect
member.summary: ModerateEffect

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.IntenceEffect
member.summary: IntenceEffect

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.Polished
member.summary: Polished

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.Inset
member.summary: Inset

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.Cartoon
member.summary: Cartoon

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.Powder
member.summary: Powder

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.BrickScene
member.summary: BrickScene

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.FlatScene
member.summary: FlatScene

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.MetallicScene
member.summary: MetallicScene

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.SunsetScene
member.summary: SunsetScene

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SmartArtQuickStyleType.BirdsEyeScene
member.summary: BirdsEyeScene

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode
member.summary: Represents node of a SmartArt diagram.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.ChildNodes
member.summary: Returns collections of all child nodes of current node. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.Shapes
member.summary: Returns collections of all shapes associated with the node. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.TextFrame
member.summary: Returns or sets text of the node. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.IsAssistant
member.summary: Returns or sets the node as assistant. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.Level
member.summary: Returns nesting level of the node. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.BulletFillFormat
member.summary: Returns the FillFormat object that contains fill formatting properties for a node bullet. Note: can return null for certain types of SmartArt layout which does not provide bullets for nodes. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.Position
member.summary: Returns or sets zero-based position of the node among sibling nodes. Read/write .
member.exception: Value is less than 0. -or- value is equal to or greater than siblings count.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.IsHidden
member.summary: Returns true if this node is a hidden node in the data model. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.OrganizationChartLayout
member.summary: Returns or sets organization chart layout type associated with current node. Read/write .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode.Remove
member.summary: Remove current node.
member.returns: True if removed succesfully, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNodeCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of SmartArt nodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNodeCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns node by index. Read-only
member.param: The zero-based index of the element.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNodeCollection.AddNode
member.summary: Add new node or sub node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNodeCollection.RemoveNode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove node or sub node by index.
member.exception: index is less than 0. -or- index is equal to or greater than siblings count.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNodeCollection.RemoveNode(Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNode)
member.summary: Remove node or sub node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArtNodeCollection.AddNodeByPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Add new node in the selected position of nodes collection.
member.exception: position is less than 0.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt
member.summary: Represents a SmartArt diagram.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt.AllNodes
member.summary: Returns collections of all nodes in SmartArt object. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt.Nodes
member.summary: Returns collections of root nodes in SmartArt object. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt.Layout
member.summary: Return or set layout of the SmartArt object. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt.QuickStyle
member.summary: Return or set quick style of the SmartArt object. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt.ColorStyle
member.summary: Return or set color style of the SmartArt object. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt.IsReversed
member.summary: Return or set the state of the SmartArt diagram with regard to (left-to-right) LTR or (right-to-left) RTL, if the diagram supports reversal. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ISmartArt.AsIGraphicalObject
member.summary: Allows to get base IGraphicalObject interface. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ICell
member.summary: Represents a cell in a table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ICell.OffsetX
member.summary: Returns a distance from left side of a table to left side of a cell. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ICell.OffsetY
member.summary: Returns a distance from top side of a table to top side of a cell. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ICell.FirstRowIndex
member.summary: Returns an index of first row, covered by the cell. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ICell.FirstColumnIndex
member.summary: Returns an index of first column, covered by the cell. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ICell.Width
member.summary: Returns the width of the cell. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ICell.Height
member.summary: Returns the height of the cell. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ICell.MinimalHeight
member.summary: Returns the minimum height of a cell. This is a sum of minimal heights of all rows cowered by the cell. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.IBlobManagementOptions
member.summary: A Binary Large Object (BLOB) is a binary data stored as a single entity - i.e. BLOB can be an audio, video or presentation itself. A number of techniques are used to optimize memory consumption while working with BLOBs - which was already stored in the presentation or be added later programmatically. Using you can change a different behavior aspects regarding BLOBs handling for the instance lifetime.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBlobManagementOptions.PresentationLockingBehavior
P:Aspose.Slides.IBlobManagementOptions.IsTemporaryFilesAllowed
member.summary: This property defines if temporary files can be created while working with BLOBs, what greatly decreases the memory consumption but requires permissions to create files. All files will be deleted after work with the presentation will be finished.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBlobManagementOptions.TempFilesRootPath
member.summary: The root path where temporary files will be created. Hosting process should have permissions to create files and folders there.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBlobManagementOptions.MaxBlobsBytesInMemory
member.summary: Defines the maximum amount (in bytes) that all BLOBs in total may occupy in memory. First, all BLOBs loading into memory as default behavior and only when it reaches the limit defined by this property, other mechanisms (such as temporary files) can be involved. In terms of performance, the most efficient way is storing BLOBs in memory, but from the other side, it leads to a high memory consumption what may be undesirable. Using this property, you may set the optimal behavior for your environment or other requirements. This property will be ignored if is set to false. It makes no sense to limit the maximum BLOBs in memory, because if is set to false, the memory is the only place where BLOBs can be stored.Default value is 629,145,600 bytes (600Mb).

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.LoadingStreamBehavior
member.summary: The passed to a method is considered as a Binary Large Object (BLOB) (see description). Values of this enumeration identify how the should be treated when it passed to the method. Depending on the requirements, different decisions could be made to provide the most efficient behavior.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.LoadingStreamBehavior.ReadStreamAndRelease
F:Aspose.Slides.LoadingStreamBehavior.KeepLocked

member.summary: Provides methods to set metered key.
