member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.PresentationLockingBehavior
F:Aspose.Slides.PresentationLockingBehavior.LoadAndRelease
member.summary: The source will be locked only for a time of constructor execution. If is set to false, all BLOBs will be loaded into memory. Otherwise, other means such a temporary files might be used.This behavior is slower than , and if it is possible to pass the ownership of the source to , it is recommended to use .

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.PresentationLockingBehavior.KeepLocked
member.summary: The source will be locked for a whole lifetime of instance, until it will be disposed. is must be set to true for using this behavior, otherwise exception will be thrown.This behavior is recommended, it is faster and consumes less memory than .

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.PresentationLockingBehavior.LoadAndRelease_Legacy_TemporaryDefault
member.summary: The source will be locked only for a time of constructor execution, all BLOBs will be loaded into memory. This behavior is the legacy behavior to provide backward compatibility. The same behavior can be achieved by using and set to false. Please consider choosing the or behavior, what is the most suitable for you. After will be removed, will be the default behavior.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ILicense
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ILicense.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ILicense.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ILicense.ResetLicense
member.summary: Reset the license
member.remarks: Use this method to reset license in component

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ILicense.IsLicensed
member.summary: Check if licence is applied to component
member.returns: True if component is licensed, otherwise false

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify additional options (such as format or default font) when loading a presentation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.LoadFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets format of a presentation to load. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.DefaultRegularFont
member.summary: Returns or sets Regular font used in case source font is not found. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.DefaultSymbolFont
member.summary: Returns or sets Symbol font used in case source font is not found. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.DefaultAsianFont
member.summary: Returns or sets Asian font used in case source font is not found. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.OnlyLoadDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected. Value of true means that only document properties must be loaded from an encrypted presentation file and password must be ignored. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation must be loaded with use of right password. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always ignored. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public and property value is true then document properties cannot be loaded and exception will be thrown. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.WarningCallback
member.summary: Returns or sets an object which receives warnings and decides whether loading process will continue or will be aborted. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.BlobManagementOptions
member.summary: Represents the options which can be used to manage Binary Large Objects (BLOBs) handling behavior, such as using of temporary files or max BLOBs bytes in memory. These options intended to set up the best performance/memory consumption ratio for a perticular environment or requirements. A Binary Large Object (BLOB) is a binary data stored as a single entity - i.e. BLOB can be an audio, video or presentation itself.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ILoadOptions.DocumentLevelFontSources
member.summary: Specifies sources for external fonts to be used by the presentation. These fonts are available to the presentation throughout its lifetime and are not shared with other presentations

member.summary: Returns or sets the bottom margin (points) in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.summary: True if text is wrapped at TextFrame's margins. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ITextFrameFormat.AnchoringType
member.summary: Returns or sets vertical anchor text in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ITextFrameFormat.CenterText
member.summary: If NullableBool.True then text should be centered in box horizontally. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ITextFrameFormat.TextVerticalType
member.summary: Determines text orientation. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and custom angle in property RotationAngle. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ITextFrameFormat.AutofitType
member.summary: Returns or sets text's autofit mode. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ITextFrameFormat.ColumnCount
member.summary: Returns or sets number of columns in the text area. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Value 0 means undefined value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ITextFrameFormat.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between text columns in the text area (in points). This should only apply when there is more than 1 column present. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ITextFrameFormat.RotationAngle
member.summary: Specifies the custom rotation that is being applied to the text within the bounding box. If it not specified, the rotation of the accompanying shape is used. If it is specified, then this is applied independently from the shape. That is the shape can have a rotation applied in addition to the text itself having a rotation applied to it. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and predefined vertical type in property TextVerticalType. Read/write .
member.example: Consider the case where a shape has a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise applied to it. In addition to this, the text body itself has a rotation of -90 degrees counter-clockwise applied to it. Then the resulting shape would appear to be rotated but the text within it would appear as though it had not been rotated at all.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IGrayScaleEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which representsepresents a Gray Scale effect. Converts all effect color values to a shade of gray, corresponding to their luminance. Effect alpha (opacity) values are unaffected.

member.summary: Immutable object which represents a glow effect, in which a color blurred outline is added outside the edges of the object.

member.summary: Radius. Read-only .

member.summary: Color. Read-only .

member.summary: FillBlendMode. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IFillOverlayEffectiveData.FillFormat
member.summary: Fill format. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaFloorEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Floor effect. Alpha (opacity) values less than 100% are changed to zero. In other words, anything partially transparent becomes fully transparent.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IDuotoneEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents a Duotone effect. For each pixel, combines clr1 and clr2 through a linear interpolation to determine the new color for that pixel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IDuotoneEffectiveData.Color1
member.summary: Returns target color format for dark pixels. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IDuotoneEffectiveData.Color2
member.summary: Returns target color format for light pixels. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IColorChangeEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents a Color Change effect. Instances of FromColor are replaced with instances of ToColor.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IColorChangeEffectiveData.FromColor
member.summary: Color which will be replaced. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IColorChangeEffectiveData.ToColor
member.summary: Color which will replace. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IColorChangeEffectiveData.UseAlpha
member.summary: Returns a boolean value which determines if alpha component should be used. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IBlurEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents a Blur effect that is applied to the entire shape, including its fill. All color channels, including alpha, are affected.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IBlurEffectiveData.Radius
member.summary: Returns or sets blur radius. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IBlurEffectiveData.Grow
member.summary: Determines whether the bounds of the object should be grown as a result of the blurring. True indicates the bounds are grown while false indicates that they are not. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IBiLevelEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents a Bi-Level (black/white) effect. Input colors whose luminance is less than the specified threshold value are changed to black. Input colors whose luminance are greater than or equal the specified value are set to white. The alpha effect values are unaffected by this effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IBiLevelEffectiveData.Threshold
member.summary: Returns the threshold value. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaReplaceEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents and Alpha Replace effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are replaced by a fixed alpha.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaReplaceEffectiveData.Alpha
member.summary: Returns new alpha value in the interval [0..1] Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaModulateFixedEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Modulate Fixed effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaModulateFixedEffectiveData.Amount
member.summary: Returns an amount of effect in percents. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaModulateEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Modulate effect. Effect alpha (opacity) values are multiplied by a fixed percentage. The effect container specifies an effect containing alpha values to modulate.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaInverseEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Inverse effect. Alpha (opacity) values are inverted by subtracting from 100%.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaCeilingEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Ceiling effect. Alpha (opacity) values greater than zero are changed to 100%. In other words, anything partially opaque becomes fully opaque.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaBiLevelEffectiveData
member.summary: Immutable object which represents an Alpha Bi-Level effect. Alpha (Opacity) values less than the threshold are changed to 0 (fully transparent) and alpha values greater than or equal to the threshold are changed to 100% (fully opaque).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Effects.IAlphaBiLevelEffectiveData.Threshold
member.summary: Returns effect threshold. Read-only .

member.summary: Base class for immutable objects, which represent effect.

member.summary: Returns the color format of a bullet of a paragraph with no inheritance. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns the picture used as a bullet in a paragraph with no inheritance. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns or sets the style of a numbered bullet with no inheritance. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBulletFormat.IsBulletHardColor
member.summary: Determines whether the bullet has own color or inherits it from the first portion in the paragraph. NullableBool.True if bullet has own color and NullableBool.False if bullet inherits color from the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IBulletFormat.IsBulletHardFont
member.summary: Determines whether the bullet has own font or inherits it from the first portion in the paragraph. NullableBool.True if bullet has own font and NullableBool.False if bullet inherits font from the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IBulletFormat.ApplyDefaultParagraphIndentsShifts
member.summary: Sets default non-zero shifts for effective paragraph Indent and MarginLeft when bullets is enabled (like PowerPoint do if enable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). If bullets is disabled then just reset paragraph Indent and MarginLeft (like PowerPoint do if disable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). Indents shifts are applied in regard to current bullet context - IBulletFormat.Type, .NumberedBulletStyle and FontHeight of first portion. Non-zero indents shifts are applied to effective Indent and MarginLeft of current paragraph (make result values to be local values).

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager
member.summary: Presentation password protestion management.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager.EncryptDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation is password protected. If true then document properties is encrypted in presentation file. If false then document properties is public while presentation is encrypted. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is encrypted. Read-only .
member.value: true if presentation was loaded from encrypted file or method was called ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager.IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected and document properties of this file are public. Value of true means that only document properties are loaded from an encrypted presentation file without use of password. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation is loaded with use of right password, not only document properties are loaded. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always false. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public then property value is always false. If PresentationEx.EncryptDocumentProperties is true than IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded property value is always false. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager.IsWriteProtected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this presentation is write protected. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager.EncryptionPassword
member.summary: Returns encryption password. Read-only .

member.summary: Encrypts Presentation with specified password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager.RemoveEncryption
member.summary: Removes the encryption.

member.summary: Set write protection for this presentation with specified password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IProtectionManager.RemoveWriteProtection
member.summary: Removes write protection for this presentation.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.IPortionFormat
member.summary: This class contains the text portion formatting properties. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate text portion formatting properties defined for the particular portion. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ISlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified slide to the end of the collection.
member.remarks: When cloning a slide between different presentations slide's master can be cloned too. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered. If you need more control over cloning process use or for cloning slides, or for cloning layouts and for cloning masters.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ISlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ISlide)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified slide to specified position of the collection.
member.remarks: When cloning a slide between different presentations slide's master can be cloned too. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered. If you need more control over cloning process use or for cloning slides and for cloning masters.

member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified slide to the end of the collection.
member.param: Layout slide for a new slide.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ISlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified slide to specified position of the collection.
member.param: Layout slide for a new slide.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ISlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified source slide to the end of the collection. Appropriate layout will be selected automatically from the specified master (appropriate layout is the layout with the same Type or Name as of layout of the source slide). If there is no appropriate layout then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.param: Master slide for a new slide.

If there is no appropriate layout in specified master then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.exception: Thrown if there is no appropriate layout in specified master and allowCloneMissingLayout is false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ISlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified source slide to specified position of the collection. Appropriate layout will be selected automatically from the specified master (appropriate layout is the layout with the same Type or Name as of layout of the source slide). If there is no appropriate layout then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.param: Master slide for a new slide.

If there is no appropriate layout in specified master then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.exception: Thrown if there is no appropriate layout in specified master and allowCloneMissingLayout is false.

member.remarks: Returned value is always defined (is not float.NaN). Assigned value must be defined (not float.NaN). You can set undefined values for RawFrame instance properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IShape.Y

member.remarks: Returned value is always defined (is not float.NaN). Assigned value must be defined (not float.NaN). You can set undefined values for RawFrame instance properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IShape.Width

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IShape.Height

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition
member.summary: Represents slide show transition.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.Sound
member.summary: Returns or sets the embedded audio data. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.SoundMode
member.summary: Set or returns sound mode for slide transition. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.SoundLoop
member.summary: This attribute specifies if the sound will loop until the next sound event occurs in slideshow. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.AdvanceOnClick
member.summary: Specifies whether a mouse click will advance the slide or not. If this attribute is not specified then a value of true is assumed. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.AdvanceAfterTime
member.summary: Specifies the time, in milliseconds, after which the transition should start. This setting may be used in conjunction with the advClick attribute. If this attribute is not specified then it is assumed that no auto-advance will occur. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.Speed
member.summary: Specifies the transition speed that is to be used when transitioning from the current slide to the next. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.Value
member.summary: Slide show transition value. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.Type
member.summary: Type of transition. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.SoundIsBuiltIn
member.summary: Specifies whether or not this sound is a built-in sound. If this attribute is set to true then the generating application is alerted to check the name attribute specified for this sound in it's list of built-in sounds and can then surface a custom name or UI as needed. Read-write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ISlideShowTransition.SoundName
member.summary: Specifies a human readable name for the sound of the transition. The property must be assigned to get or set the sound name. Read-write .
member.remarks: This name appears in the PowerPoint user interface when configuring the transition sound manually.
member.exception: When property is not assigned.

member.summary: Returns main sequence which may contain only main effects collection. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.IAnimationTimeLine.TextAnimationCollection
member.summary: Returns collection of text animations. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.IBaseSlide.Equals(Aspose.Slides.IBaseSlide)
member.summary: Determines whether the two IBaseSlide instances are equal. Returning value is calculated based on slide's structure and static content. Two slides are equal if all shapes, styles, texts, animation and other settings. etc. are equal. The comparison doesn't take into account unique identifier values, e.g. SlideId and dynamic content, e.g. current date value in Date Placeholder.
member.param: The IBaseSlide to compare with the current IBaseSlide.
member.returns: true if the specified IBaseSlide is equal to the current IBaseSlide; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns or sets bottom edge of the fill rectangle that is defined by a percentage offset from the bottom edge of the shape's bounding box. A positive percentage specifies an inset, while a negative percentage specifies an outset. Read/write .
